You are a slave

Knowingly, or unknowingly

Apr 28, 2020

You are a slave. You might be thinking what nonsense! It‚Äôs ok, that‚Äôs a normal human response to anything to which your belief system disagrees to.
I clearly want to state I am not going to explore this topic from a symbolic(or existential) perspective, i.e, I wouldn‚Äôt be talking about the fact that we are slaves to time, God, or any other phenomena, that is not under our control.

I will explore the slavery you have put yourself into yourself. Knowingly or unknowingly, that‚Äôs another issue. Read the post completely, or simply don‚Äôt read at all. Half read post will do you more harm than good.

If you‚Äôre reading this in the 21st century, chances are you are already a victim of ‚ÄòDigital Dementia‚Äô, in simple words, you are a slave to technology. Ever felt that you‚Äôre kind of lost and dizzy after a long session of screen time? Well, that is a clear symptom of dementia. And yes, I know there‚Äôs a difference between relying on something, and being a slave.

Ok, so it started like it starts every time. In America, British settlers came, the Red Indians didn‚Äôt pay much attention, and boom, the land was no more theirs. Something same happened in India. Britishers came for trade, and we welcomed them with open arms. Trade was beneficial for sure, but we failed to keep their actions and desires in check. Result? 200 years of slavery.

The case with technology has been quite similar. Tech came in 1990s for the masses, suddenly erupted like wild fire in 2000s and was now a part of our lives. In this decade, we became heavily reliant on technology. Same mistake once again. We lost the track of when we became followers of technology, instead of it being the other way round. The time frame in which tech became mainstream is just too short, it is 15-20 years, and as expected, we humans couldn‚Äôt see the harmful impacts.

When social media addiction first came under public attention, that was probably the first time the human society was alarmed. Then came an endless number of serious addictions associated with technology. Porn addiction, gaming addiction and now, addiction to video content.

You know what‚Äôs really interesting? Many people simply deny that they are addicted. They know they show every possible symptom, yet they fool themselves saying, ‚ÄùOh, I can keep down the phone whenever I want to!‚Äù Really? Then why is there such an unease when you can‚Äôt find your gadget near you for sometime? Why can‚Äôt you stay away from social media for a few days?

Because you don‚Äôt want to. In better terms, your brain doesn‚Äôt allow you to. The need to secrete the feel good hormone surpasses logic and rational thinking. The thing about the ‚Äòfeel good hormone‚Äô dopamine is that it is the same hormone that makes a sane alcohol consumer alcoholic, a person (just )trying drugs a drug addict and a smoker, a chain smoker(not the band). Honestly, I personally struggle from the problem of addiction from time to time. The games! God they are just so mind blowing.

Here‚Äôs a shocking news: Big corporations around the world are making billions of dollars out of your bad habit of addiction. The fact that you have become a slave to technology is the biggest reason why world‚Äôs top 5 corporations(with valuation over $600 billion each) are from tech industry.

Let‚Äôs do some analysis about how is it harming you:

  • It‚Äôs affecting your mental health. Addiction of any sort is directly correlated to increase in anxiety, stress and sleep issues.

  • You are lagging behind. Your time is limited. 24 hours a day. That‚Äôs the time everyone has. You can either pursue your goals in that, or can waste it. Wasting too much time on things that aren‚Äôt helpful will naturally result into lesser time for necessary stuff, ultimately you lag behind.

  • It affects your relationships. Whether it‚Äôs family, friends or your romantic partner. No one remains unaffected. You are a node in a huge network. If one node malfunctions, all nodes connected to it will naturally be affected.

It affects your physical health too. I don‚Äôt think I need to explain how.

Basically, it will kill you before your normal expiry date.

Another slavery is something I‚Äôm dead sure you are a victim of. It‚Äôs food. Did you know that sugar can be more addictive than cocaine? Chances are, you didn‚Äôt.

Here‚Äôs a mind blowing fact. A person having a protein rich breakfast will have higher chances of being agreeable, even going as far as to accept an unfair offer presented to them. Sounds funny, right? But it‚Äôs serious. This is just one of the thousands of ways your mind, habits and ultimately life can be affected just by giving you a specific kind of diet, without any added drugs or chemicals.

I‚Äôm sure you might have read again and again that junk/fast food is bad for health, and like most people, your mindset would be that it causes obesity, cholesterol and heart diseases, basically ‚Äòphysical problems‚Äô, but these foods have a far serious impact on your mental health.

  • They make you a junkie. Your taste-buds give you a pleasing sensation when you eat something. Basically, your brain secretes dopamine, which we discussed above.

  • They mess with your circadian rhythm.

  • They affect your productivity. Unhealthy diet impacts your circadian rhythm negatively, thus affecting your productivity. How? Not going to explain. Go read circadian rhythm through above link.

You need to understand that your mind and body coexist. One‚Äôs health affects the other‚Äôs. Ever wondered why people suffering from depression become really thin(or fat)? Well, you know now.

See, the thing is, you are a slave of your own desires(in a deep sense), and the reality is, you can get out of this slavery for sure, but it‚Äôll be hard. Your brain will eventually trick you, deceive you or even force you to continue your unproductive(and bad) habits, but with proper strategy and persistence, you shall get over this problem.

There is a fantastic solution to your problem. To successfully deal with the problem, I advise you to take the dopamine fast. The video from improvement pill describes the dopamine fast in an outstanding manner.

Keep going, never give up.
